classes

Class Photo

  • java.lang.Object
    • classes.Photo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Photo
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Photo is an object that holds the actual image and the various information about it: Time and Date, tags, etc
    Author:
    Samuel Uganiza, Nicholas Petriello
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Photo(java.lang.String filePath)
      Creates a photo object with the given file path.

      Returns this photo's calendar object.

      Returns this photo's caption.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Photo

        public Photo(java.lang.String filePath)
        Creates a photo object with the given file path. Automatically sets the photo's calendar object to use the last modified date of the given file.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The file referenced by the photo

        public boolean deleteTag(Tag delTag)
        deleteTag() finds the tag and deletes it, if its in the list.
        Parameters:
        delTag - The tag String to be deleted
        Returns:
        true if it was removed; false otherwise

      • searchTags

        public boolean searchTags(java.lang.String type,
                          java.lang.String value)
        Returns whether or not this photo contains a tag with the given type and value.
        Parameters:
        type - The type to search for
        value - The value to search for
        Returns:
        Whether the tag is contained in this photo

      • isWithinRange

        public boolean isWithinRange(java.lang.String startDate,
                             java.lang.String endDate)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Checks whether or not this photo's date is contained with a pair of dates. The start date and end date are converted into Date objects and are guaranteed to be in the proper format due to regex checking in the search dialog associated with searching photos by date.
        Parameters:
        startDate - The start of the range
        endDate - The end of the range
        Returns:
        Whether this photo fits in the given range
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Parse exception ignored due to proper formatting
